result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura K Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

IF REVOKED
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year
CORRECTED TO 20 MONTHS.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation

Blood draw fee and DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the City of Waukesha Police Department

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, Random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX, or drug paraphernalia

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Inform agent of all prescriptions

Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

timeConds.notes: CONDITION TIME - First 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. Balance of sentence to be served on electronic monitoring. Commences forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura K Smith

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:43 a.m.
Attorney Patrick Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Laura K Smith. 
Defendant Laura K Smith in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  44 MONTHS (updated on 10-6-22)
Initial Confinement:  20 MONTHS (updated on 10-6-22)
Extended Supervision: 2 YEARS
 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 1-year.
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No Operation of a Motor Vehicle without a valid driver's license

D/L REVOCATION: 35 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 35 months.

FINE: $ 3,660.50 (Includes IID Surcharge)
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $36.05 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

CONDITION TIME:  TOTAL SENTENCE 11 Months HUBER (standard release conditions)
First 6 Months with Huber (standard release conditions)
Balance of the Sentence to be served on Electronic Monitoring

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day from being released.

01:09 PM Defendant Laura K Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if a WCS non compliance is received, the Court will issue a warrant.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
